channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Anerley Station Road SE20 at, 7th June
item.description:
Anerley Station Road SE20 attached to streetlight ID number 3 (outside railway station) bicycle frame locked to post – no wheels etc – inspect & remove please. Not Lime or similar bike so did not fit under 'abandoned cycle item.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Anerley Station Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Sofas on Risdon Street next to the bins, 7th June
item.description:
In the 1st photo the sofa, armchair, drum and the other bits and pieces were dumped there between 12 and 1 this afternoon. The sofa on top was dumped there tonight as I watched them walk past my kitchen window with it. It happens on a regular basis and you the council just allow it to happen time and time again. My question is “what are you going to do about it”?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 41 Malvern road, 7th June
item.description:
This chair has been here for weeks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Abandoned bird cage h&s hazard, 7th June
item.description:
This was reported last month and got marked as resolved when it was not collected for rubbish. The items remain on the 3rd floor of the bin chute and staircase by no.79 of Scriven Court. Please remove ASAP as it will attract pigeons, mice, pests

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Haggerston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mercedes in white blocking exit to main road, 7th June
item.description:
There has recently been a RTC involving this car yet it has been moved to a position that is very dangerous blocking traffic from joining a main road so cars are joining the main road on the wrong side of the road, this is parked not in regulation with the Highway Code and is causing issues in the area for the last 2 days… also causing cars on the main road to stop putting people at risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hall Place Crescent, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of parking bay, 7th June
item.description:
There are no markings they have all faded and traffic wardens keep trying to give refuse ts parking outside their own home

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cumberland Avenue, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin full of water with two dead rats inside, 7th June
item.description:
There is an unused bin in the alleyway next to 35 manor road. It has filled with rainwater and two rats drowned in to it and I believe have sunk to the bottom. Mosquitoes are also laying their larvae in the water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Torbay Road all along the road, 7th June
item.description:
There is always so much litter from the start of Torbay Road all the way through at least to crossing with Clarence Road. Can the council provide regular street cleaning service rather than one off reporting and cleaning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Torbay Road, London
